intro: Jupunba curvicarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit jupunba, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture.
